meanings.sent1: Lack of proper tools can disenable a person from fixing the broken chair.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a blindfold can disenable someone from seeing clearly.
meanings.sent3: Trying to read with sunglasses on can disenable your eyes from focusing properly.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog disenabled the driver from seeing the road ahead.
meanings.sent5: A sudden power outage disenabled the entire building, leaving everyone in darkness.

meanings.sent1: Leaving the batteries in the rain can disenable the remote control.
meanings.sent2: A clogged drain can disenable the sink from draining water effectively.
meanings.sent3: Using a broken pen can disenable you from writing smoothly.
meanings.sent4: A virus can disenable a computer from operating normally.
meanings.sent5: A loose connection can disenable the lights from turning on.
